title: Grand Central Rail
location: Northern House, Rougier Street York YO1 6HZ GB

items.title: Personally I have always been happy…
items.review_text: Personally I have always been happy with the service and find it much cheaper than the LNER. Perhaps the rolling stock could do with updating but it’s no worst than many other TOCs

items.title: A shocking service...AVOID
items.review_text:
Platform announcements were only 8 minutes prior to departure, resulting in a crowded dash to the train. 
The seats are very uncomfortable with no proper lumbar support.  Many passengers, including elderly people, found no room for their luggage. 
A shocking service and I will advise you never to travel with GC.

items.title: walking would be easier.
items.review_text:
if gold medals were awarded for incompetence grand centrals . medal cabinet would be overflowing.
booked and paid for ticket 23/03/24 to travel on 19/04/24. To be sent  1st class
post and arrive within 3 days wot could possibly go wrong
25 days later plus numerous phone calls still no ticket. They told me I had to cancel this ticket and purchase a new one at twice the price. I surgested may it was Thier problem shortly after that, they hung up. I would not trust them to wipe Thier own rrrrs.

items.title: Not many trains-and a miserable, uncomfortable experience every time
items.review_text: Hardly any trains- running hours apart. We were crammed in like hot sardines,  I normally have to stand on my return journey, whenever I buy an open return ticket. Today it was too hot -I thought I was going to suffocate or pass out standing on the London to York -I was nearly crying -I ache from head to foot, I made a little video on the train -it’s truly shocking!  It looks years overdue a refit and refurb. Gosh, even 1st class is quite old, dirty and scruffy. The toilets are disgusting, the food “cardboardish.  Why did we privatise the trains?   Abroad, the trains are so modern, gleaming, clean, well air- conditioned- absolute luxury by comparison, it’s as if they actually care about the comfort of the passengers. Grand Central must save all their money for the bosses, bonuses, and shareholders payouts, while we make do with cattle-class squalor in exchange for good money. How mean.

items.title: Helpful Staff
items.review_text:
I was late and missed a train to Grimsby from London. Hamsa a staff with Grand Central offered a ton of help that enabled me get to Grimsby amidst my anxiety. 
This man represented GC to its fullest on this day! I hope he gets his flowers!! We all need staff like Hamsa!!!

items.title: Woeful
items.review_text: Woeful. I had assistance booked. They did not post the platform at Kings Cross till 15 mins before departure. I then had to struggle to the train as doors close 10 mins before. The train was then the wrong one as it was behind the one closest to the station . This meant another 3 or 4 minute walk.The phone charger was broken  I had first class. I had travelled from Paris with little time in between trains. My offer was 1 hot drink and corn chips/ shortbread. Sandwiches were payable. Absolutely shocking

items.title: This company's lamentable unreliability…
items.review_text: This company's lamentable unreliability is exacerbated by its odious excuses for not paying compensation. My train to York was cancelled with no one at Kings Cross to provide advise. I travelled on LNER ultimately incurring further cost. Submitting delay repay by post they now appear to have lost the paperwork and refuse to pay unless proof of posting is supplied. Having lost the original tickets they appear unable to apply common sense and trace my booked seat to my name on the train cancelled which proves the booking was made and paid for. In my view this company is among the worst of the TOCs and are utterly dismal.

items.title: See my review of 16 January
items.review_text: See my review of 16 January: I now travel with LNER, first-class, for the same price. Chalk and cheese - LNER's premium service is polished and effortless; clean and comfortable, no QR-code nonsense, as staff regularly attend your seat with hot food, drinks, beverages, served with proper china, real knives and forks, napkins and glasses. Also, the journey, with the same number of stops, is 25 minutes' less. There's no going back.

items.title: ZERO STARS - AVOID
items.review_text:
Traveled from York to Kings Cross on 12.03.24.
Despite requesting an aisle seat and by a luggage rack, none of this was facilitated.
Passengers had no space to put their luggage or fit in the seats. 
They had also closed an area where we could have put our luggage.
Delayed by 20 minutes and no compensation.
Their website shows that they only start offering compensation after 60 minutes. What is this? An airline company?
At least the staff was friendly and professional, but the company itself is another joke, the usual in 2024.
AVOID

items.title: No luggage space at all
items.review_text:
No luggage space at all. The luggage "space" was full with 3 small cases. Is it a surprise that people on a train may have luggage???? The overhead luggage space is only deep enough to take a small rucksack, not even a cabin suitcase.
 Seats are very cramped, and the "lumbar support" in the wrong place so you spend your whole trip pitching slightly forward.
Staff on board were absolutely lovely, very apologetic and helpful.

items.title: Avoid!
items.review_text: No at seat service in first class. ‘A technical issue’. Grand Central should not be selling first class tickets as they are unable to provide an appropriate service. Had a bad experience on the way to London and equally bad on the return journey. Paid a similar price to LNER and LNER provide a premium service.

items.title: Do Not Use Based on my Experience
items.review_text:
Booked a train on 24 Feb 2024 on the LNER app as one way was LNER, the other a Grand Central train. This was not easily identified at the time, but they sell tickets for each other.

My trains were cancelled very late, so the same day I submitted a request for a refund via the LNER app. LNER refunded my return journey swiftly for their journey, but after a few weeks said I need to apply via Grand Central for the other. I did this 29 days after the 28 day limit so they used this excuse to decline a refund of just 31 Pounds. I fully accept it was a day late, but it was only delayed due to me initially applying via LNER, so you would expect some leniency here. 

As a result of this experience I now strongly recommend you do not travel with Grand Central as if they can get out of refunding you, they will.

If someone from GC sees this and would like you to reach (220561 refers) out, then let me know and I will be more than happy to update this review, but as it stands I will never travel with them again.

items.title: Go with LNER instead!
items.review_text: Crammed onto train with the train before cancelled therefore all the people from the previous train here. No seats for 3 hours and paying a premium for this. Furthermore, no effort to alleviate any of the issues for passengers. Avoid at all costs! Competitor LNER is more professional.

items.title: Cancelled train because " The Conductor…
items.review_text: Cancelled train because " The Conductor phoned in sick" . We arrived on time to meet our train start at 10.00 on 17/3/24 . Looked at the board and to our horror it said "train to Kings Cross cancelled" . An employee told us the conductor had phoned in sick . What a way to run a business. This is why the service along the North East coast line is mostly empty . Shame its going one way and thats closure in future,

items.title: Booked seats unavailable
items.review_text: Unfortunately after booking a seat , when we arrived they had put on a different smaller train carriage  & our ( along with many others ) seat didn’t exist .When I enquired with a guard , I was told to go along the train to find 2 spare unbooked seats - most unhelpful. There was no luggage room so had to place our suitcase along with others in the aisle .When we went to the buffet car to order a sandwich we were told to use the QR code which did not work - no wifi on the train & my phone had no service . When we informed the person in the buffet car of this fact they were of no help whatsoever .This is the first & last time I will be travelling with Grand Central - very disappointing !!!

items.title: Friendly staff, but….
items.review_text: Friendly staff. Train ran on time - today.  However, extremely uncomfortable and cramped seats (I felt like I was being folded in half - I’m only 5’7” - and that my neighbour was sitting on my lap), dirty windows and headrests and overhead luggage racks that have room for a thought but not much more.

items.title: First Class with Premium Cost - Expect no premium services!
items.review_text:
Where do I start with the 1 star ranking: lack of wifi, food and beverage….
Booked a first class as a morning departure and naively assumed that the service in first class will be similar to LNER (ticket price and time differential was not material).
What a stark difference between first class between the two trains. LNER have clearly got their first class as a premium service scoped perfectly! Grand Central has zilch for first class - unless you count a pack of crisps and brioche to collect from food counter as premium service. 
For anyone looking to use Grand Central’s first class…booking a regular ticket, buy food and beverage of your choice and it will still work out cheaper with no difference to services or comfort!

items.title: Aviod Grand Central
items.review_text:
We had a return trains booked from Wakefield Kirgate to London Kings Cross, both trains were cancelled at short notice. We received notification by a text message about 1 hour before departure for both journeys. The text message gave no instructions on alternative arrangements. 

When I complained at a later date we were told alternative arrangements did exist. This may be the case but  if they are not communicated they are of no use. The infrequency of Grand Central trains means I have to recommend find an alternative service.

items.title: Not worth the saving
items.review_text: Tonight I stood outside a locked Grand Central train at King's Cross Platform 1 together with 100 other passengers watching the staff inside eating and drinking right up to the scheduled departure time. Normal for Grand Central, whose staff despise passengers. Then a platform change was announced and we all ran round to Platform 2 and piled onto a different train while it was still being cleaned.  Train departed late.  Toilets stank badly enough to fill the whole carriage.  There was no soap.

items.title: No refreshments available for a 3 hour journey.
items.review_text:
It was great that our train was on time this morning, however the experience was slightly dampened by the fact that there was no hot drinks available for our 3 hour train journey from Brighouse to London. Really disappointing as the temperatures are minus degrees outside. Staff were really apologetic and understanding though.

We were originally informed that there was no hot drinks but there was actually no refreshments available for the entire journey, this is not good enough.

items.title: Had to chase refund for last-minute train cancellation
items.review_text:
Booked a ticket for my daughter from King's Cross to Sunderland for 22.12.2023. Train was cancelled while she was on her way to the station. Had to buy a ticket for her on a LNER train departing a few minutes later. Neither Trainline ("unrefundable" - it was CANCELLED!!), nor Grand Central ("we're not the retailer" - it was YOUR train!!) will refund. Avoid.
UPDATE: After a chase-up from me, Grand central spoke to Trainline and arranged a refund.

items.title: AVOID
items.review_text: AVOID! Worst train service by far, no idea how they are still in business and only train company everyone is glad when they strike. Paid for 1st class service and got nothing due to broken machines and computers and no air con. Contacted customer services twice, ignored Grand Central Rail you need to do something before you loose all your customers

items.title: appalling train doncaster to kings…
items.review_text: appalling train doncaster to kings cross cancelled . went down by lner . return journey next day also cancelled . rang grand central asking what to do . they told me basically USE ANOTHER COMPANY as if i hadnt worked that out myself . they need nationalising judging by all other reviews

items.title: Cheap tickets but low quality
items.review_text: Wifi never works. Few occasions i have tried 1st class and its more like premium economy not 1st class. Supposed to get a free drink and snack but rarely available. QR code menu scanning often down. Uses old/unwanted rolling stock from other companies. Only benefit is cheap travel usually but sadly this means a cheap experience.

items.title: Do not use Grand Central
items.review_text: Do not use Grand Central. Had my original train cancelled and a 1 hour+ delay on the (much) later train, yet they refused to compensate me for any of the ticket price. By far the most backwater, run down awful train company going. Might as well walk.

items.title: Absolute joke of a company
items.review_text: Absolute joke of a company. Purchased tickets to return from London Kings Cross to Doncaster at 16.27. Train cancelled at short notice. Arranged to get on 15.25 train as an alternative as advised by the sales team (customer service closed on Saturday), cancelled!!! Last train out of London at close to 8pm. Informed no other train companies accepting their tickets! Gone on LNER. Will never use this company again!!!

items.title: To be avoided
items.review_text: Well, I wish that I had read the reviews on here before I booked!  Good price for a first class ticket, but uncomfortable/broken seat, the carriage vibrated so much you couldn’t work on it.  Flaky WiFi, Only got a free coffee and snack and nothing substantial to eat is the buffet bar (so bring your own good!).  Staff tried hard and were pleasant but will actively avoid GCR in the future.

items.title: Have you no pride?
items.review_text:
Sweltering, hermetically sealed, stuffy carriage with no ventilation. Truly uncomfortable.
Hang your heads in shame Grand Central Rail management. If you can’t even get the basics right, it’s time for you to go. Why haven’t you addressed this most basic design problem; have you no pride?
I’ll avoid travelling with you until you ensure your coaches are properly ventilated or did you not notice the last pandemic!

items.title: Time it was nationalised.
items.review_text: Our train was cancelled without receiving any notification.  This meant losing our first class seats as the alternative was already fully occupied.   On the return journey the train was so packed they declassified first class so no drink or snack and impossible to reach the buffet car due to the aisle and entrances packed with standing passengers.  Not allowed to use tickets on LNER services.  A complete mess.  Friends had to drive down or get a bus instead to ensure they got to their concert booking.

items.title: I used to prefer travelling with Grand…
items.review_text:
I used to prefer travelling with Grand Central as they stop at my local station and are not too expensive, but lately the service has really gone downhill. Lots of cancellations, standing in doorways/sitting on floor, or having to change trains in Doncaster or whatever. First Class is a waste of money. No trolley service, dirty toilets, poor customer service. There is very little ticket inspection especially when the train is busy, I recently had someone sitting in my reserved seat and staff  just put me in an empty seat without checking if the person had a ticket or asking him to move.
Also paid for first class ticket but coach had a group of  loud potty mouthed drunk yobs.
When I complained the member of staff just shrugged his shoulder. He didn't check their tickets or have a word with them to make less noise. Needless to say, I have already booked my next journey with LNER and future journeys with Grand Central have been put on hold.

items.title: Disappointing jouney on G C
items.review_text: Travelled to kings cross from eaglescliffe Friday 17th June hottest day of year, train on time but air con not working in our carriage.   We were offered a seat move.  Return journey Sunday 19th, cancelled with little notice.  No real contingency plans, put on next train that transpired was already fully booked, stood all way from London.  Team at kings cross, very unorganised, in fact appeared quite panicked, which did not help situation.

items.title: Very disappointing
items.review_text:
Firstly, platform sign stated our carriage at zone 5 but it was at the other end of the train/platform
Secondly, platform sign stated refreshments on board and as travelling 1st class didn’t need to buy coffee/cake before boarding. Asked train manager when seated how we order as per website and she informed us she had been making announcements that no refreshments available as employee phoned in sick. Very disappointed this wasn’t mentioned on York Station sign as could have bought something.

items.title: Unbearably cold!
items.review_text: I travel on this service from Sunderland to London every week and the air conditioning is atrocious. For anyone that isn’t sat in first class, it’s unbearably freezing cold. I’ve tried walking to different carriages, complaining to the staff and all I am told is that the air con has to be kept at the level it is, so it reaches the entire five carriages. That’s all fine and well, but we can’t all afford to be in first class! I gave this review two stars only for the cheaper price compared to LNER.

items.title: Such poor quality service
items.review_text: Such poor quality service. Granted their is a storm and flooding but Grand Central cannot even update its own website alerts, last information update 24 hrs ago advising not to travel, all trains today up until writing this (12pm) cancelled but their website doesn't even tell you this. The link to their 'Live Service Updates' reports no current updates, the link to their twitter? Last tweet 2020. A quick check of all other rail company sites give clear up to date information. Such a shame, I was a big fan of them when they first arrived, they are clearly struggling as a company and customers suffer unnecessary frustration as a result.

items.title: Don't trust it to run all the way!
items.review_text:
Twice my daughter has used Grand Central to visit her daughter and twice the return train has only run to Wakefield Kirkgate. Why?
The first time, she had booked a short time beforehand all the way to Bradford Interchange with no mention of it finishing early. Why?
There was a rumour that it had been cut short to accommodate staff training! So, inconvenience passengers in order to train staff? I've heard everything now, even for a railway company!

items.title: As good as you can expect on British trains
items.review_text:
I have used Grand Central several times and always found the service good. Staff are friendly, prices if you book early enough are the best value you can get on British trains from the North to London. Booked a return Northallerton to London 28/29th December. Despite engineering works the train was on schedule both ways (a bit slower than normal but we knew this when booking), staff were good, reservations worked. Train was full but everyone was seated
As good as you can expect on British trains at the moment

items.title: Terrible DO NOT USE
items.review_text: honestly grand central absolutely sucked i waited 2 hours at london kings cross to take the train to bradford interchange and guess what? it got CANCELLED!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! luckily i used LNER to take me to leeds, better operator than GC. DONT USE THIS GARBAGE OPERATOR

items.title: Dismal Experience With Grand Central
items.review_text: Had the misfortune to travel with Grand Central on the 19th April from Kings Cross to York. Old, uncomfortable, noisey and ridiculously hot train. Train broke down at Peterborough and we transferred to an already busy alternative train whose passengers were kicked-off at Doncaster. First and last time I will travel with Grand Central. Compensation for delay is another journey on Grand Central. No thanks, I would rather walk.

items.title: No luggage rack and bad seats
items.review_text:
Cheap tickets, but there was NO luggage rack in carriage F, so there is literally no where to put your luggage! The overhead racks are too small for normal luggage.

Also, the seats are awful - they should fire the designer who throught it was a great idea to add very large and hard shoulder pads to the seats - you are basically sat in hunchback for 3 hours. Terrible for your physical health!

A refurbishment is long overdue.

items.title: Sadly, the worst train company going - good stops, but awful serice
items.review_text:
Sadly, this train company is the worst.

They have great routes which is the only reason I HAVE to use them.

If the train comes, you are ok.

That is if it isn't cancelled which about 90% are.

You might think "can't be that much", you are wrong. They always cancel some on the day, ALWAYS. 

They usually cancel some in advance too so you have 1, or if you are lucky, 2 GC trains to pick from.
I am not joking, it is that bad.

They often don't get "an agreement with another operator" so you can't just get other trains, you wait for their specific ones OR you can get the next GC train, if there is one there is.

You usually will have your train cancelled. It is a miracle if it goes ahead.

If they cancel the train, you often have to deal with 2 changes on trains to get to your destination, or wait for the next GC train, which could be many hours away as they only run a few a day, and most are cancelled each day for the same reasons.

Reasons for cancellations are ALWAYS:

1. Train was broken down
2. Too many trains needing repair at the same time.

Being disabled, I can't do 2 change trains, so I have to use GC who are the only direct train from the area.
If they cancel the train, I have to wait for the next GC as I simply can't do the 2 changes due to disability.

And even then, you have no seat and the trains are full, and most people don't move for disabled people who aren't in a wheelchair sadly.
Most are selfish, so we are left in agony, sitting in the door ways on the floor...

Those are the reasons you will get every day on GC.
EVERY DAY.

items.title: Booked first class ticket  1348 (return…
items.review_text: Booked first class ticket  1348 (return journey) from London KX to Eaglescliffe. Train cancelled as engine broke (engineer?). Barely any announcement other than train cancelled.  Then had to get on next train an hour and a half later and stand in FIRST CLASS  virtually the whole way. Whole train jam packed with people standing Complementary drinks impossible.  Appeared to be no contingency arrangements whatsoever.  Appalling.

items.title: Lots of Cancellations
items.review_text:
I’ve lost count of how many trains I’ve had cancelled on me, and the tickets aren’t eligible to catch the more regular LNER services when this happens.

This also means you lose your seat reservation and the trains are often full, you have to sit in the boiling hot areas between carriages. Not good. 

On board staff are usually really friendly, and are clearly doing the best job they can.

items.title: About as useful as a chocolate teapot.
items.review_text: Can't comment on the trains, as didn't set eyes on one, both our outward and return train from Brighouse to London were cancelled leaving us stranded in London overnight. The tannoy announcement that we could come back the next day and still use our tickets about as useful as a chocolate teapot (the cost of two hotel rooms if we could even find any, over £500, and there was no offer to pay for that !). As all LNER trains to Leeds were also cancelled, we spent 12 hours waiting overnight at Kings Cross station waiting for the next train. Not something you want to do aged 73.

items.title: Useless
items.review_text:
Booked a trip to London for a 18th birthday surprise 
Booked a direct train to King's Cross ended up changing 3 TIMES!!!!!!!!! Resulting in being nearly 2 hours late meaning we couldn't do half of the stuff we booked for the day

Then the train home was cancelled for no reason given meaning I had to spend over double the original amount to get home 
I definitely don't recommend and won't be using again honestly useless

items.title: Grand central
items.review_text:
Grand central. 
Women checking tickets on the 11.27 to Sunderland 1/5/23 Rude. Patronising and very unhelpful lecturing me for apparently not having the right ticket even though I spent £100 for a ticket. Tried to get me to pay another £100 or would get the police involved. Making me feel like a criminal. 

Heartless women still kept lecturing me after I broke into tears having explained id lost my daughter very recently.

Never met anyone so mean

items.title: Booked first class, no first class carriage
items.review_text: Booked first class. Literally no first class carriage today, its been removed so A, B, C, D and F are accomodating the missing carriage passengers. Except they aren't, I've been moved twice now despite having a reservation, no catering to seat available and cramped conditions. I am standing in a corridor writing this because it's the only place I could get peace. Intended to work on the train so already behind. Leaving the service early and changing to LNER at Doncaster.

items.title: I travelled to London from Halifax on…
items.review_text:
I travelled to London from Halifax on the 8th the service was shocking 3 staff stood in the buffet bar but I had to collect my sandwich from the buffet bar the AC in carriage B was either freezing cold or normal - the guard checking the tickets simply confirmed yes it's either on or it's off ....... very useful indeed shocking service

Then to add to the shocking service the train back on the 9th was cancelled due to the number of trains requiring repair ..... never again truely shocking service

items.title: unhelpful customer service
items.review_text: i do really enjoy travelling on grand central but the people running the twitter account are totally useless. they can’t seem to answer a question with the information you need, or they just don’t know and won’t say that. the website says i need a reservation to travel on strike days however a guy on twitter told me i didn’t need one?? i tried to make a reservation and they said no to me but were giving reservations to others. is the train full or am i not someone you want on your trains? is this boris johnson or a rail company

items.title: First Class
items.review_text: First Class, what an absolute joke! You get a bottle of water and that's it for the extra money. I actually measured the (extra room) you get and the luggage section is exactly the same, and the top luggage is actually smaller than the standard class. You have to use an app to order food, it barely works. When the super super slow internet does load the page you have to pay for your drinks! coke can £1.20, Gin and Tonic £4.50! Absolute terrible service. The socialist nut jobs that run this train service need educating on what first class is. Utter disgrace!

items.title: Absolutely terrible service (i.e. none)
items.review_text:
I don’t understand how this company continues to exist.

I’ve booked 8 GC trains since December ‘22 and 5 of those have been cancelled. Why advertise services that you cannot provide?

‘First class’ basically means a brew and some shortbread. That’s if they’ve managed to get any food or drink on board before you set off…

Switched to LNER now, not worth the hassle of trying to get anywhere on a Grand Central service.

items.title: Cancelled trains… so many cancelled…
items.review_text: Cancelled trains… so many cancelled trains. The usual excuse tends to be due to a fault with the train. We even had a cracked windshield but to be honest the really reason seems to be maximising profits without reinvesting train fares into improving carriages and service times. I will purposely avoid using Grand Central again as it is affecting our business.

items.title: Uncomfortable and out dated and…
items.review_text: Uncomfortable and out dated and terrible terrible slow. So they could not help the engineering work being carried out but it just made the journey from Doncaster to London and back so uncomfortable. The seats are at a strange angle which is comfortable for about 20 minutes but then you feel like your sliding down the seat. Both trains were incredible hot and due to cancelled services they had combined several service together so every seat was full adding to the heat.  The carriages are cramped so if your sitting in the isle every time someone walks pass extremely expect to be banged into. Overall it was just an uncomfortable journey. Think I’ll be going back to the Sheffield London route for the next visit.

items.title: Do not use this company
items.review_text:
Do not use this company - try LNER or hull trains if travelling from Doncaster to London 
Three times in as many weeks booked Doncaster to King’s Cross and every time the train arrives with only 4 standard coaches and every seat is booked yet they still allow ticket sales and have to stand the entire journey 
Poor service

items.title: Absolute shocking service
items.review_text: Absolute shocking service. Booked 2 returns to London travelling 3rd Dec and returning 5th Dec. Outbound journey 5 carriages on a train from Sunderland to London stopping at York and was packed before it arrived in York, everybody crammed in like cattle irrespective of ticket type with no checks done at all.  Inbound journey was cancelled on day of travel, absolutely no trains available to travel back to York so cue a round trip to Manchester then York. I would sooner walk next time than travel with this outfit. They are a disgrace and avoid at all costs.

items.title: Sad excuse for a train operator
items.review_text:
About 1 out of every 3 of the trains I have used is actually on time. The company seems to just have no incentive whatsoever to perform. This operating company has a particularly free and easy attitude to delays on off-peak trains.

But what might surprise you is how equally bad and unprofessional the customer service is at their head office (I do NOT include frontline/onboard staff in this).

items.title: AVOID AT ALL COSTS
items.review_text:
AVOID AT ALL COSTS 
This rail company should not still be running. They are incompetent, useless and unreliable. They cancel trains and leave their “customers” stranded with no other options or help. They mess up and then take no responsibility for it! Appalling company! Should be shut down

items.title: Do not use at any price - terrible, will cost you time and money.
items.review_text:
1st use of Grand Central for business, the driver advised the train encountered a fault resulting in 2.5hr delay to my business trip. 

2nd use of Grand Central for business, the train departed whilst all notice boards at Kings Cross station (and travel apps) advised the train was delayed and the rescheduled departure time was still 5 minutes away. GC customer service advise that they take no responsibility for trains departing whilst customers were being advised of a delayed departure time.      

Do not use. Expensive at any price.

items.title: Cancelled train at 2am - safer to book with LNER
items.review_text:
My York to London train was cancelled a few hours before departure. In order to make my meeting had to buy new tickets on LNER. Meant a family with 3 kids had to stand 2 hours to London. 
Grand Central Rail are famous this. SO UNRELIABLE. Do yourself favour and just avoid them and book yourself onto LNER which are just so much more reliable.

items.title: Shame on you Grand Central
items.review_text: Train cancelled within minutes of it being due. Cost us £250 in taxis from Brighouse to Leeds and tickets for LNER. This was a month ago - no refund on the original tickets. No response to my complaint about additional costs to us as there were no other Grand Central services we could use and no agreement with LNER. I am spreading the word as widely as possible - never use this dreadful company. We had been warned and paid the price for taking a chance. Don't make the same mistake as we did!

items.title: very sweaty and boiling
items.review_text: usually have no problems with this train, is very clean and enough room and toilets on board, unfortunately this time i have been on a 2 hour train and it’s felt like i’ve been cooking in an oven, everyone on board has fans out and i am very uncomfortable, told can’t adjust air conditioning. a shame because obviously you want to travel comfortably and i have now sweated through all my clothes and my hair is stuck to my head.. hopefully you don’t have any plans after getting off the train

items.title: Awful service from Grand Central
items.review_text:
GC used to be reliable from Mirfield to London, but not any more. Their service has deteriorated massively recently. They have cancelled my last 2 booked trains and never inform their customers on their website. The only communication is on Twitter, so you turn up at the station only to find out the train is cancelled. Shockingly bad service, with alternatives given using TPE, Northern, or EMR, not LNER which would actually get you into London at a reasonable time. 
Their customer service team doesn’t work at weekends, so who are you supposed to speak to?
Totally unacceptable. Book with LNER, much more reliable

items.title: Thoroughly uncomfortable journey from…
items.review_text:
Thoroughly uncomfortable journey from York to Kings X on the 1710 today!

Ridiculous seats where unless you are a dwarf the headrests are at shoulder level, so spend the whole journey hunched forward.

And the temperature in carriage C was way too warm must have been at least 25C.

items.title: The most uncomfortable train I have…
items.review_text: The most uncomfortable train I have ever been on.  The seats have no support for your back, completely crippled by the time we got to our destination. Nowhere for luggage and thrown around constantly.  Won't be issuing them again, I'd rather pay the extra £100 and go with LNER from Durham.

items.title: "Advised "to use LNER
items.review_text: "Hi Keith, thanks for trying out Grand Cancel, next time we recommend trying LNER for the best experience. ^PR"-- "  This was from Twitter Customer services at Grand Central believe it or not !. The Customer service  is appalling with people having to wait nearly a month for replies,refunds or delayed payments. Trains that are "ex"  are from other TOC that have been given a lick of paint,carriages that have leaking roofs with are covered with duct tape,toilets not working and overcrowded trains with people standing,or being told to cram into Coach B which has unreserved seats.( 1-20 in fact ).. I'll take up their recommendation. as 9 times out of 10 I use LNER. Once GC were the best on the East Coast Mainline but this year is the worst of the worst  and you're not worth a ZERO rating. !

items.title: Overall pretty good compared to other…
items.review_text:
Overall pretty good compared to other Train companies.
Trains are always clean and staff nice.
They could do with improving their customer service when you make claims or have issues. Had to wait over two months to get a refund for a delayed journey.

items.title: I have never had a significant problem…
items.review_text:
I have never had a significant problem with Grand Central and use them regularly for trips between West Yorkshire and London. 
My biggest annoyance is the discomfort. The seats look beautiful, but as a woman of just under 5'5", the seats are hideously uncomfortable. They are slightly too high so I get pain in my legs due to the pressure of not being able to put my foot flat on the floor (I can't see a single woman near me that can). They are too long in the seat so I can't comfortably lean back, the back is angled and shaped for a much taller person so curves inward where I need lumbar support. A slightly more ergonomically universal design could be considered in the next trains to increase comfort for many passengers.

items.title: Yet again my service was cancelled with awful service since
items.review_text: Yet again my service was cancelled - leaving me with going 4 hours early or 4 hours late. I could only go early otherwise I missed my appointment. It cost me a lot extra to go early. Not only did they take a full month of chasing and calling and emailing to sort out my "delay repay" claim, they turned it down as I got their early not late. Totally cancelled services happens a lot, I can't afford to risk it any more so will be using a different provider in future.

items.title: Even as a carnet ticket holder who uses…
items.review_text: Even as a carnet ticket holder who uses the service twice I week I can't speak highly of Grand Central.  The customer service is so inconsistent, some nice staff and some officious.  The phone team are terrible.  It's such a shame as it could be such an excellent service.  When this book of carnets run out, I'm reverting back to LNER.

items.title: A very poor show..
items.review_text:
Well, predictably my train was cancelled so I had to take the next available one, two hours later. I was astonished by the poor condition of the rolling stock. The carriage shook all the way from York to London. The axels were whining as though the bearings were worn down. The seats were grubby and all the paintwork was peeling off. I suspect these carriages were old refurbished Intercity 125 stock from the 1980s.
The only positive thing I can say is that the staff were very polite and helpful considering we were packed like sardines into what was obviously a very overbooked relief train. I shall be using LNER from now on as at least they run the modern Azuma trains.

items.title: Train cancelled yet again.This is now…
items.review_text: Train cancelled yet again.This is now twice in travelling 2 times. No seats reserved on the later train. Makes the whole experience stressful and really starts a holiday off to a bad start.Having to stand all the way from Hartlepool to London is not good enough.Im sure the subject of compenstion will be brought up but all we want is a service offered thats advertised.Rubbish!

items.title: Appalling experience
items.review_text: Awful, awful experience. Run down, dated train. Broken air conditioning on a red hot day in August. Hand dryer out of action in the toilet. No working WiFi. Safe to say I will never use this dreadful train company again. Avoid.

items.title: You can ALWAYS rely on Grand Central
items.review_text: You can ALWAYS rely on Grand Central - to cancel, delay & make you miss connections thus prolonging your journey by hours. It's happened so many times now Im not booking them again.

items.title: Disgraceful operation should be forced out of business
items.review_text: I am 71 years of age, have a broken finger and today had to travel from York to London sitting on the floor in beteeen carriages because passengers from a previous cancelled train were sitting in my (and my wife’s) paid for and reserved seats. Disgraceful and absolutely no help from train staff or ticket collector. Unfortunately no option to award no stars

items.title: meh.i mean looking at reviews of other…
items.review_text: meh.i mean looking at reviews of other train companies of the uk,grand central is the best.I went with my mum and i from york to sunderland.Train was clean but unreliable as usual.price is so high that we nearly coudnt afford it so price sucks.however,not as bad.an average experience.

items.title: Strike weekend..short notice cancellation
items.review_text:
Strike weekend... All LNER trains cancelled so booked a Grand central from Wakefield kirkgate for 9.42.....that now cancelled with only 40 minutes notice... Now deicing the car....
Truly awful service.... Won't be booking with them again

items.title: Book elsewhere if you have the option
items.review_text:
Book if it's so much cheaper that you can't consider any alternatives, otherwise just avoid...

On GC trains we've experienced repeat issues where air con broken (always carriage d!), repeat issues of carriages leaking when it rains & you have to move seats or get wet, a request for help with seat reservations for someone with limited mobility messed up & double booked, having card payment issues making the catering coach cash only so you're stuck without food/drink if you don't have it, WiFi issues.

It's also been MONTHS now of cancellations due to more trains that usual needing repairs. This has impacted me personally since at least March, why isn't it sorted yet?

Makes me wonder if GC are heading into going out of business?!

items.title: Will never use again!
items.review_text: Will never use again, back to LNER. I booked a first class ticket and the charging sockets weren't working, there was no Wi-Fi, the seat tray wasn't there, the seat was broken therefore couldn't recline, there was no complimentary food, there was no food to seat service and no hot water meaning you couldn't even buy pot noodles.

items.title: Late, cancelled, stressful - never again
items.review_text: Trains are regularly late or cancelled - the chaos today has added another two hours to my journey. When they do arrive, trains are old and uncomfortable compared to other operators. I’ll happy pay more money to use LNER and avoid Grand Central going forwards.

items.title: Absolutely appalling company
items.review_text: Absolutely appalling company. Both trains on my journey to and from London this week were cancelled, costing me a huge amount to rebook at the last minute. This company needs to be taken under national control, like LNER and TransPennine Express.

items.title: Very terrible service style
items.review_text: Very terrible service style. Booked GC twice in a week and both trains were cancelled causing me to miss my connecting trains and leaving me stranded for absolutely no genuine reason. I won’t ever use GC again and definitely won’t recommend!!!!

items.title: Average all-round
items.review_text:
Travelled from London to Halifax yesterday using GC. I paid for first class, which was very poor value, with the only real perk being plenty of space in the carriage (standard was very busy). First class will get you some complimentary snacks and one drink...no real food. The train isn't smooth, which means my coffee was spilling everywhere anyway.

The first class carriage was untidy, with some tables having bottled water scattered on them and some not.

The main advantage of taking this line is to avoid changing at Leeds if you are heading to the Halifax or Calderdale area, since the change is much easier (assuming trains are on time).

I'd like to point out that I travelled in the opposite direction outbound using LNER also via first class and that service was excellent with hot lunch menu and loads of drinks, snacks etc. Train was quicker smoother too. Just a much better experience all-round.

items.title: Really disappointed with Grand Central
items.review_text: Really disappointed with Grand Central. As a frequent traveller to London  was thrilled when we got a direct Halifax to London train, and loved the service, happily paying extra for first class.  However it feels like the company no longer values either the route or the passengers.  There is nothing first class about First Class any longer and there are frequent cancellations…. Including our 14.57 train yesterday.

items.title: Iv never expected or experienced a 2022…
items.review_text:
Iv never expected or experienced a 2022 train journey  
by grand central on 1st class 
Grand central 1st class is not good enough for the money ∧ is an insult to the customers, I couldn’t  get my WiFi working properly , I couldn’t get any food orders on the website 
Cheap cup’s full to the brim with very hot water , which you had to make yourselves, it is a disgrace 
I will never ever use your trains again , I feel let down by your services 
Upon my arrival to Hartlepool, I will inform every commuter about your miss guided service 
Mr Hickman

items.title: A poor experience overall
items.review_text:
A poor experience overall. Overly priced to begin with. I was then met by a polish National (gender unidentifiable) who abused me on the train! 

No GC member of staff was around. Avoid unless you want to travel with trash! Not to mention the seats are incredibly uncomfortable! The customer service is also very poor and no response is received when contacting Gc

items.title: These seats are so uncomfortable
items.review_text: These seats are so uncomfortable, they are curved so you have to slouch. Has flared up my sciatica, going a 3 hour trip I had to balance on the edge of the seat, whilst my back burned in pain. There is no reason to have seats the curl, pretty sure the spine isn't supposed to be unsupported for several hours at a time. Saw many people stretching uncomfortably, both men and women.

items.title: My experience is similar to other reviewers on this site. Be Warned!
items.review_text: The Grand Central rail service has deteriorated dramatically. I booked tickets in advance from York to London return. Both legs of the journey were  “planned cancellations” but I was not advised. I had to buy a walk on fare with LNER in order to get to London. There was no information at the station about the train I should have travelled on and customers were in the dark. Weeks have passed trying to obtain compensation, no time scales met and eventually no compensation for the considerable increase in my costs because of the cancelled service. Will never travel with Grand Central again, I’m prepared to pay more to avoid this awful service.

items.title: Not First Class
items.review_text: Travelled from Eaglescliffe  to Kings Cross on the 12/6/22. Paid for First class travel, but it was not worth it., I had expected the same excellent level of service as LNER on my outbound journey, but there was no comparison just free tea and biscuits and a bottle of water. Generally very poor service. One carriage had no air conditioning, and then we had to stop to pick up passengers from a broken train. LNER was cheaper and so much better, will not be travelling Grand Central again

items.title: Good customer service
items.review_text:
I use them sometimes.

Recently there was a problem due to bad weather and I contacted their customer service who were superb.

They dealt with the issue cordially and promptly and sent a refund right away.

items.title: I suffer from complex ptsd and i…
items.review_text:
I suffer from complex ptsd and i struggle to travel,but this morning i was on the 07.55 from Northallerton to london kings cross,tracey the train manager was brilliant with me,she understood my needs and moved to first class and kept an eye on me for the whole journey and when i arrived at kings cross,she saw me off the train and handed me to the lner station staff.
She went way and above what you would expect.
Thanks Tracey

items.title: Would not recommend Grand Central
items.review_text: Would not recommend Grand Central. Despite departing from King's Cross on time, which I appreciated, I found the seat very uncomfortable. Also, both the bacon sandwich and coffee I ordered were disgusting! They really do need to improve the food.

items.title: 1ST CLASS return tickets to London KX…
items.review_text:
1ST CLASS return tickets to London KX from Eaglescliffe £260.00 for two people, not worth it.
+ Both trains departed and arrived on time! Yay!
- No Wifi available on both journeys to/from London said no IP address could be established.
- To order food in 1st class you had to scan a QR code and order on the App which did not work.  Only available was disgusting coffee, biscuits and crisps on way down, on way back, much of the same but with the prospect of a dry croissant with jam.  
You can do better Grand Central, as Eaglescliffe is near to me, LNER are strides ahead with 1st class service, albeit you have to travel to Darlington.  Disappointed Traveller.

items.title: First class is not worth the extra money
items.review_text: Traveled recently from London to York for the first time on grand central first class.  Having used the LNER first class previously it doesn’t compare.  There are no lounge facilities to use, it has very limited complementary catering which has to be ordered via a phone app, disgusting toilets and miserable staff members. The seats were comfortable but there are limited charging facilities so if you are sat at a 4 person table you have to rely on the the other passengers allowing you to drape a charging cord across their lap.   All in all not what I expect from First Class

items.title: No wifi. No power. Toilet blocked.
items.review_text: Where do I start? Halifax to London. No power for charging. No wifi. Toilet blocked. No staff passed through my cabin during an almost 3 hour journey to speak with. No drinks trolley. Got me there and back roughly in time on this occasion.

items.title: Currently stood on the london kings…
items.review_text: Currently stood on the london kings cross to Halifax. Yes. That’s STOOD for 3 1/2 hours on a packed and overfull train. Grand central trying to to say it is down to line issues and other train company’s which is TOTALLY wrong. Apparently the two prior trains were cancelled shortly after we were able to book our seats -10 weeks ago - and they did nothing to advise or rearrange of the service. Health and safety completely out of the train window and no doubt Grand Central will be receiving a flurry of complaints. Mine included. Probably won’t do a thing about it.

items.title: Good experience, trains on time
items.review_text:
Travelled on the Bradford Interchange to London train both ways.
Train was on time for both routes, the carriages reasonably clean and comfortable.

One issue is that attendants are not very easy to find if you need to speak to someone.

items.title: First of all there was no coach f where…
items.review_text:
First of all there was no coach f where we booked the tickets. 
And the staff said take a sits where you can find. But later  one staff (men i don't know his name) come and said that we have to move on our sits😐(coach was not exists)he was extremely rude, no respect,or his attitude was very bad just because we are not english.he discriminate us on the front of all passengers. Very bad person.

items.title: Unreliable service
items.review_text: Unreliable service, old rolling stock, poor customer service, especially bad at responding to complaints. Am a regular traveller between Halifax & London so really hoped that GC would provide a good service. They haven't got close.

items.title: Terrible experience.  Don't use this service!
items.review_text: Paid for a first class ticket and the only food included was a very small poor selection of snacks.  The air con was blasting out so much I had to wear my coat over my legs to try and stay warm.  The toilets were disgusting.  Smelt terrible and there was toilet paper all over the floor.  The service itself was delayed due to an issue at Stevenage and then a level crossing fault which meant I arrived home over 2 hours later than planned.  The last time I used this train was to travel to London in the morning and it was cancelled at the last minute.  The next grand central train was a 3 hr wait so had to buy another ticket (twice the cost of the advance return I had bought) to get me to my appointment in time.  Worst service I have ever used.

items.title: SO HOT MY PHONE TURNED OFF
items.review_text:
Yes I travelled from York to Kings Cross today, 1st October, 20 degrees Celsius outside, not crazy hot. No air at all. Hard to breathe. No water in toilets to wash hands. No soap in dispensers. Can’t have been properly     checked on departure. And train wasn’t even full!
Just awful 😭

items.title: Very poor quality trains
items.review_text:
The trains are too hot or too cold, frequently break down, the Sunderland trains are all damaged at the front and covered in what looks like duct tape.

Noisy, uncomfortable and wobbly.

I think I’ll revert to going on LNER from Durham again.

items.title: Shoddy
items.review_text: Thought it was weird that we couldn't book a specific time on the Sunday for a return but went with it anyway on an open return. Got to kings cross and train cancelled. Not enough reserved seats booked on the service apparently. If thus had happened with LNER we'd have had multiple other routes home however we're now having to catch a train to miles from where we need to be so we can make our way home in bits at considerable cost. I won't be using them again.

items.title: While the actual rail service is…
items.review_text: While the actual rail service is usually quite bad (as with all companies in the UK unfortunately), the staff are lovely and amazingly helpful in the face of this without fail. Recently on the KGX->Bradford Interchange train that got delayed (7:49 train, 3/06/22) Elaine and the rest of the crew were absolutely phenomenal in this irritating situation and made sure all the passengers were okay. Genuinely top notch customer service & they all deserve kudos

items.title: Goodness me what sort of train company…
items.review_text: Goodness me what sort of train company is this?!?! I rarely use this route as I live on Great western line but booked grand central to York and it was just cancelled with no alternative provided - not even option to use the ticket on LNER?!?!

items.title: Only get one star because there isn't…
items.review_text: Only get one star because there isn't an option for no stars!! Our train from Eaglescliffe to King's Cross was cancelled the night before, we booked it 5 months previously!!! The option was go on a full earlier train or full later train. When I got in touch they said they had reserved 2 seats in coach B which is unreseveable?? Was no good as there were 4 of us anyway. In the end had to cancel and get a refund then drive down and back. Wil NEVER EVER use Grand Central again. They should have their licence revoked and put into public ownership  like they did with Trans Penine.

items.title: Paid extra for 1st class and extremely…
items.review_text: Paid extra for 1st class and extremely disappointed. Dilapidated train... no WiFi working, worn seats, and on a single seat which had no table as it had been removed! No table meant no QR code to access food menu but nice lady on the train took my complimentary order verbally. Very poor choice compared to 1st class in othet services I have used. In addition very nice lady did zap the QR code for me from a other table... twice.... because no WiFi meant with tunnels etc kept timing out. Finally got on to order some hot food and .... only menu showing was the complimentary items no access to the hot food and cold beverages! As a single traveller with mobility issues left me unable to order anything to be delivered to my seat.  Very poor 1st class experience and will not use Grand Central trains again.

items.title: Train cancelled with no notification
items.review_text: Train cancelled with no notification. If I hadn’t checked to see what time I needed to leave in the morning I wouldn’t have known. Trying to get a refund as I can’t use the ticket on any other service and I don’t know if I’ll get a seat on another train. So had to book with the far more reliable LNER. Absolute joke of a company. And the reviews here only strengthen my view of them as that.

items.title: Terrible service. Trains cancelled. Given a choice of a 4 hour wait at Kings Cross or to buy a ticket with a different company.
items.review_text: Terrible service. Disgraceful. Two trains cancelled this afternoon due to breakdowns and not the weather. Three out of 7 Grand Central Trains had broken down today. I would have had a 4 hour wait at Kings Cross which would have left my young daughter out in the snow as the train that may run would arrive over an hour after the after school club closed. I had to pay for a new ticket to travel with LNER. Grand Central don’t care, they don’t have a ticket sharing arrangement with other companies. Never again. Unreliable and expensive due to the need to purchase a last minute ticket for LNER.

items.title: Will not use them again!
items.review_text: First their trains were cancelled and then the refund/compensation issue. It's been 2 months and even after going back and forward still no refund. I can't believe they charge over £200 for return tickets to London. Feel like the service is run by Liz Truss.

items.title: No WiFi No Electrcity for next 2 weeks
items.review_text: Went from York to London first class. Announcement in the train telling us no electricity and no WiFi....Will stay like this for the next 3 weeks. What a service.....

items.title: Unreliable Company
items.review_text: No stars really.  Train from Brighouse - Kings X & return cancelled the day before with a feeble excuse of no ‘fleet available’.  They only knew the day before???? Had to scramble around to book on LNER at much extra cost.  It is appalling for GC to treat their customers with such disregard.  The company needs to be taken over like TPE.

items.title: Cancelled my train with no notice…
items.review_text: Cancelled my train with no notice whatsoever. Checked whether my train was cancelled the night before, or whether there were any problems during my journey, but nothing to be found. Now I missed my Eurostar train because I had to wait 2 hours for the next train. Thanks for costing me 180 euros to get back home. What a disgrace.

items.title: Horrific seats …
items.review_text: Clean. On time. Seat reservations worked. But the seats are absolutely the most uncomfortable seats ever. I’m 5’3” and slim. The seats are curved so I was literally slumped in my seat with my back in the worst position possible. My feet couldn’t reach the floor. Virtually every woman on the train was sitting perched on the edge of the seat, elbows on the table. 2 hours of utter hell. My 6’4” husband was fine. Terrible. Will never travel on these trains again. I’ll ensure I’m on an LNER …

items.title: First class is dreadful, and not worth the upgrade
items.review_text: If you’re travelling for business, the catering is non existent. First class offering is no better than Standard class. Compared to LNER, it’s dismal.

items.title: AVOID AVOID use  LINER
items.review_text: We are on the train now If I could leave no stars I would. Payed £61 each for first class feeling very ripped off. A cup of tea has just arrived after an hour in a disposable cup this is absolutely nobody’s idea of first class. Traveled down from Northallerton to kings cross on LINER the whole experience is a world apart this shower does not deserve your money actually I have been ripped off

items.title: Sadly Grand Central is not the good…
items.review_text:
Sadly Grand Central is not the good service it once was.  I booked in Dec 2021 and in March 2022 and two out of three trains were cancelled.  So from my experience this is not a service you can rely on.  If it's important that you get where you need to be, on time, then use another rail company.
It's a shame - it used to be fine, and good value.  Perhaps GC was hit badly by the pandemic and then couldn't recover.  Unless something changes for the better, I doubt it will be in business much longer.

items.title: Worst train company ever!!!
items.review_text: Worst train company ever!!!! train broke down m, got stuck inside the train for 2hrs so arrival delayed for 6hrs! no bus replacement! and to make it worse, they will make it difficult for you to claim compensation for their poor service!!!! Avoid this train at all cost!!!!

items.title: Absolutely appalling service
items.review_text: Absolutely appalling service. Return from Sunderland to London kings cross. Was given an unreserved ticket not sure why when on my way there I had a reserved seat and had to sit on the floor near the toilets. Never will use again this is horrendous avoid at all costs

items.title: I had the misfortune of leaving my…
items.review_text: I had the misfortune of leaving my jacket on one of the trains going from kings cross to Sunderland. It was the last stop, I tried to phone around 1-2 hours after I had realised the situation and we got a fair amount of what was to be expected. To wait and see, which we both did. After a few days we got a reference number and when leaving Sunderland we checked back with the train to see if our item had been put aside. They looked confused and told us it was possible that it could be in kings cross, we arrived in kings cross and they told us it was likely with grand central. It seems they knowingly misinformed us that the cleaning staff are totally separate to grand central, despite say items being found lost and remaining at destinations like Sunderland. It reflected poorly on the journey which itself was fairly uncomfortable.

items.title: Shame there is no option for 0 stars
items.review_text: Shame there is no option for 0 stars. This is an appalling excuse for a train service. Avoid at all costs. Unless you like being treated like a sardine packed into a carriage without a seat, at short notice, with a bunch of other people who are equally angry at the way this service operates. This company is terrible. It’s despicable that customers are charged money for such a low bar of service. Awful. I hated every second.

items.title: Whenever I travel on Grand Central I…
items.review_text: Whenever I travel on Grand Central I regret it and wish I’d paid more for the LNER train instead. Trains always seem to be delayed, over crowded and too hot. Seats are also the most uncomfortable seats ever designed. They seem especially designed to give you lower back pain the way they are curved, why? The seats on the older trains, while shabby, were more comfortable than the new seats.

items.title: Good experience today
items.review_text: Good experience from Brighouse to London today, much better than last time. Helpful platform staff and friendly staff on the train  with table service. Train not too busy and took around  2 hours 15 mins to get to London.

items.title: Used to be good but…..
items.review_text: Used to be good travel. Could get on in an unreserved coach “B”. NOW you’re lucky to get 4 available seats. Despite calling customer service and being reassured that coach B is unreserved it turns out this is not the case anymore. Disgraceful. Why advertise available seats when there aren’t any? The last time we travelled the only available seats were swooped up so we had to stand an hour and a half for our journey to Doncaster. Decided to go to the buffet car, what a joke, no ice EVER, poor choice of beverages, alcoholic or otherwise. And to add to this, despite having a long lay over at Kings Cross and the train being already prepared they only open the doors TEN minutes before departure leaving everyone to scramble aboard pushing and shoving each other out of the way. The only amiable and very pleasant staff member is the tall dark haired lady on the Bradford service, the rest seem to have a pious attitude and treat you as something they’ve trodden in.

items.title: If I could give 0 stars I would
items.review_text: If I could give 0 stars I would. I booked first class trains as a treat for my daughters birthday. We didn't receive first class service, so requested a refund, I was willing to pay standard fares as that was what we received, unfortunately grand central put me in a corner and I had to reach out to the ombudsman. They decided a refund would be adequate.  It then took 10 weeks and me having to get in touch to chase my own money back. If you have the energy to fight these then definitely take grand central, but if you do have an issue, be ready to fight. I've worked in retail for over 15 years, I know customer service and it was horrendous on every level. AVOID!

items.title: I booked an annual trip to see my…
items.review_text:
I booked an annual trip to see my family in December. My tickets were booked and paid for well in advance (to drive is a 6/7 hour drive).

I had taken leave from work for the trip. 

On the morning of the trip, I got an email to say the train was cancelled. I tried to re-arrange but every train was full or cancelled. 

There was no explanation for the cancellation and no satisfactory communication. 

I made a complaint that week and the complaint has still not been resolved.

No wonder people don't bother with trains anymore.

items.title: Overcrowded horrible service
items.review_text: Overcrowded, no luggage space, no wifi. At York, unlike other rail companies, no indication of where your carriage will stop on platform. Only on-train announcements are warnings about penalty fares. We requested forward facing seats got backwards facing. Disgusting service. No surprise from a disgusting company.

items.title: What a dismal experience !!!!
items.review_text: Overcrowded noisy diesel train with no space for luggage resulting in blocked isles and doorways. The operator needs to remove a row of seats from every carriage and install luggage racks.

items.title: Why is your app for ordering food/drink…
items.review_text:
Why is your app for ordering food/drink so poor? I can’t even use my card to buy at the counter. 
Whenever I get a grand central train I don’t even bother wasting my time on your crap app and just buy whatever I need in the station. 
Crazy situation and must result in so much lost revenue. Moronic management

items.title: Third (and last) time I travel on grand…
items.review_text:
Third (and last) time I travel on grand central. There has been no WiFi over the last few weeks I have used these trains. The hold all at the top of the carriages does not fit a small suitcase. Given that the seating areas are tiny, and there is no additional space to leave luggage bigger than a small handbag, the last few journeys have been pretty diabolical. LNER over Grand central every time. 
I was travelling for work and do not feel it is unreasonable to expect to be able to use WiFi on a train in 2022. Appalling all round.

items.title: Good value but the trains feel tired
items.review_text:
Good value (compared to alternatives) and friendly helpful staff on both outbound and return journeys.
The trains themselves feel tired though. 10 years ago they felt much better than now. They felt quite nice back then. But now less so. The engine was noisy on the first journey. You could hear the engine drone quite noticeably and sometimes did not sound healthy sounding like it was misfiring a bit on full power. Noise aside though it was fine and arrived on time. On the way back it was even louder with resonance at certain speeds causing a loud vibration reminding me of a distant fog horn. It then became apparent that we would have to stop at every station for at least an extra 5 minutes to reset the engine. The seats are a bit too curved as people have mentioned. Not a problem for me but might be for some. An hour late, staff were pleasant and apologetic but it feels like these trains need maintaining better. The words I hope we will make it back to Sunderland don't fill one with confidence!

items.title: Don't he fooled by the aesthetics of…
items.review_text:
Don't he fooled by the aesthetics of the train both inside and out. The above storage barely has room to store a small bag, twice I have had my suitcase stolen on a train so I've had to have it on top of me for the 2 hour journey to London. All other train lines above storage can fit my small suitcase but grand Central cannot. 

The leather seats look large but when you sit down you're actually crammed in. The aisles can barely fit 1 person at a time and they over book tickets so people are standing all over the place. 

Terrible.

items.title: Stationary for most of the journey 😡
items.review_text: Possibly the worst train service I have ever been on... Myself and my mum boarded at London Kings Cross and departed at York. Luckily we were on Transpenine Express from York to Durham. It took us 4 hours to get from London To York on this Grand Central service. It only took us 3 on LNER. Throughout the whole duration, our train was going no quicker than 50 mph. We constantly stopped, even though there was nowhere to stop. The train was very hot inside, and extremely full. The overhead space was too small to fit my small hand-luggage. Which was very annoying. We were stationary for most of the journey.

items.title: Impersonal service
items.review_text:
I travelled first class from Kings Cross to York. 

They don’t have first class lounges at Kings Cross or York, unlike their competitor LNER.

To get the included snacks it was necessary to scan a QR Code which I found very impersonal. I would have preferred to interact with a person. I used the train’s WiFi to open the web page for the order but it took about ten minutes just to open the page. The snacks are very poor compared to LNER’s first class. Also on LNER the servers keep coming around offering more drinks, which didn’t happen with Grand Central.

The carriage was freezing cold from the air conditioning. Someone complained to the staff about the cold but nothing happened for a long time.

The luggage racks are not deep enough to put a small case. There was no luggage space left between seats. People don’t want to put their luggage on the racks at the end of the carriage - they want to keep an eye on it.

The only good thing was the train was very fast

items.title: 3rd world service
items.review_text:
Travelled 1st class a few times with GC in the past when i can'tget a LNER, but never again. 
I ordered a coffee for me and my wife who was sat across the aisle from me with my 2 year old. Received our coffees and was sat enjoying my hot journey. My 14 year old autistic child sitting across the single table from me wanted to make his own mobile order, which he did. Then all of a sudden the lady that brought his order slung it on the table, yes slung it on the table, and said you have already ordered in a nasty voice and stormed off. Now a steaming hot coffee in a paper bag was now pouring all over both our legs. Luckily I am not a confrontational  violent human, I bit my tongue, used my sons wetwipes and cleared up the mess.
Lesson learned, GC do not do 1st class and their staff are a disgrace and I will never use their service from DON to KGX again.

items.title: Grand Central - pathetic service
items.review_text: Appalling service with zero focus on customer care; boarded a 6.59am at Bradford Interchange train to Kings Cross. The train diverted to Retford and asked everyone to disembark. The reason given was that the train had a fault but the overwhelming view was that staff could not cope with the complaints about the coffee and the internet. The person serving the coffee was depressing and just did not want to be there. 0/10 for customer care from her… anyway, we were told that a train was on the way to take us from Retford to Kings Cross; when the train did arrive (a Hull to Kings Cross train) we were told categorically that no train will pick up Grand Central passengers from Retford and that we needed to go back to Doncaster to continue our journey to Kings Cross. Why on earth did Grand Central dump it’s passengers at Retford. The customer information and service was appalling. And to repeat the coffee and tea service members of staff needs training in ‘accepting that is her job’…

items.title: Absulty terrable and disgraceful
items.review_text: Absulty terrable and disgraceful, I am writing this on behalf or my girlfriend, pregnant daughter and 3 kids who got told there brother/ uncle had terminal cancer, only benefits , Xmas coming up we got told he had a week to live, so we booked our tickets Wednesday 22nd November at 10 am train to London, on Tuesday 21st at 9.30 pm we had a call saying he wouldnt make it through the night, so we come done to station 3 hours before train, with my brother still holding out but hours to go, they wouldnt let us board with out paying a additional £40 something we never really had.......no care or thought ,this trainline is disgraceful

items.title: SHABBY SHABBY SHABBY
items.review_text: So yet again on our return journey the previous train was cancelled so they had everyone squashed  on to the 1057 on 28 Dec. This caused some arguments on the train as people from the cancelled train took it upon themselves to sit in the reserved seats for the passengers who had booked seats on the 1057. It was disgraceful the number of passengers having to stand up all the way to London. I myself stood up from Doncaster to London as I gave up my seat to a little boy who was standing up with his mother. Grand Central you have no shame. Why can’t you just let people sit in the empty First Class seats for god sakes it is just a seat!. I definitely will not be using them again I am going to go with LNER even though I will have to change at Leeds to get to Huddersfield. GOOD BYE TO SHABBY SERVICE

items.title: I’ll never travel with this company…
items.review_text: I’ll never travel with this company again. Had reserved seating on our route from London to York. The trains are over sold people standing, had a man’s crutch in my face for a lot of the journey. We upgraded to first class to come back. Thank goodness as I broke my foot and was on crutches. Found people who had not booked first class sitting in our seats eating our complimentary snacks and drinking our complimentary water. People standing in the aisles, sitting in seats they’d not booked or paid for. I asked the lady who had put the ramp down for me to get on the train where we could get our complimentary water as someone had taken ours. The lady pointed vaguely to somewhere behind her and said go and help yourself!!! Yep of course I will I’ll hobble down to where you have vaguely pointed past all the standing passengers on my crutches!!! I’ve only traveled first class once previously with a different rail company. The experience was very very different! Never again!!!

items.title: Significant delays on the way out
items.review_text: Significant delays on the way out, cancelled with 45 mins notice on the way back. Don’t bother with this company, use another train service

items.title: 1st class ..my foot
items.review_text:
1st class no free hot drinks..etc...almost impossible to understand the train 'manager'...voice training would help...seat rather uncomfortable..no 1st class lounge at King's Cross..nothing not 
 a free bottle of water...do not waste your money..

items.title: Good value but too hot onboard!
items.review_text: Great value for first class. The seats were comfortable and the trains were clean. The trains were ridiculously hot though and me and my travelling companion very uncomfortable.

items.title: Very bad customer service department
items.review_text: I am disappointed to be writing this. I had always liked Grand Central Trains. After our train to London was cancelled and our return train also very delayed, we were due compensation. I sent in the rail tickets as requested but only one set of tickets was reimbursed. I have now rung customer services 4 times and have been promised the money but it hasn’t been paid. Last time I asked to speak with the manager but guess what….they were in a meeting and didn’t even have the courtesy to call back when requested. Still no money! What do I have to do? Write to the CEO?

items.title: No notice given to train been cancelled…
items.review_text: No notice given to train been cancelled 😡, got a later train only NO SEAT 💺, sat on my suitcase next to the toilet for 2.5hours is no fun! Disgraceful behaviour from this company, would avoid if I could.

items.title: Avoid!
items.review_text: Avoid, this lot only pay out if you're delayed over 60 minutes. They could perhaps learn from Companies that pay for 15 miutes plus. I will avoid in future - once bitten!

items.title: Very poor service and customer service…
items.review_text: Very poor service and customer service very root and not helping. Never ever use this service again.

items.title: Absolutely scandalous
items.review_text: Absolutely scandalous, cancel the train 24/7, now stuck in York and have to stay over night because they can’t be arsed to come, won’t be using them again

items.title: Don’t promote WiFi if you don’t have any
items.review_text: Don’t advertise a WiFi  service on the train if you can’t provide one. Will NEVER ride on your trains again as I cannot do anything on my laptop so 2 hours wasted

items.title: Poor yet again no warm sandwiches same…
items.review_text: Poor yet again no warm sandwiches same every Monday morning, no card reader at buffet car and the app wont load complete joke

items.title: Arthritic Trains that need a new lease of life!
items.review_text:
I like Grand Central. I travel them regularly from Sunderland to London as they always seem to be the cheapest option and when I was a broke student travelling from London to the North East they always dug me out of a hole so I sort of have a sentimental feeling toward them but alas, I must be honest.

I've never really experienced a problem with their customer service. I've always found it to be brilliant and both on board and via Social Media/Phone they have been attentive and dealt with matters quickly and efficiently.

Now for the trains. This is where they really let themselves down. The trains they use are really starting to show their age. I usually go first class and whenever I travel the seating looks more and more beat up than the previous time. There shouldn't be train seats coming off in first class, the seats should be allowed to recline, this wasn't just mine, but several. I'm not really bothered too much about the catering in 1st but I do expect the hard product where you park yourself down for 3hrs+ to be fully functional and not falling apart!

As stated before, I do like Grand Central, maybe more for nostalgia than anything else but they really need to improve! Especially as the other 2 operators to the North East now (LNER and Lumo) offer a much better experience!

items.title: still in the steam age
items.review_text: mickey mouse company ...worlds best at cancelling trains at short notice .i was due to travel from doncaster to london ....would have been quicker walking it

items.title: Beware they cancel at the last minute…
items.review_text: Beware they cancel at the last minute and you won't know until your in the station.  Poor customer service and difficult to get a refund.  We shall stick with LNER in the future.

items.title: Don't just take my word that this…
items.review_text:
Don't just take my word that this company is bad read the other reviews.
My wife & I travelled to, London, First class 02/09/23 - 25 minutes late.
Returned to York 09/09/23 45 minutes late,
Being less than 60 minutes not eligible for late payment.
No service in 1st class - not even a bottle of water. If you are partially disabled or, as I am, suffering from glaucoma, there is not information, other than you can order things via the barcode at edge of table. If you do not have a phone and you want something you must walk to the serving hatch (found 2 coaches back).
