If you are partially disabled or, as I am, suffering from glaucoma, there is not information, other than you can order things via the barcode at edge of table. Personally, I am of the opinion that G D R are not fulfilling their legal requirements to help the partially sighted to get around the use the bar code – or go walk. Spoke with a female crew member who said they had to pay their own way and not eligible for Government grants. It was interesting to note that both the guard & 2 female staff managed to find bottles of water for themselves (temperature that day was 29C).
I have learnt my lesson back to L N E R
So if you have taken the time to read this and still undecided about travelling on G C R read other reviews.

items.title: Ridiculously uncomfortable seats.
items.review_text:
I am sitting on a grand central train to London, a trip I do weekly on LNER. 
I have never been so uncomfortable in my life. The curve on the seat means I have to slump and curve my shoulders so I fit into the seat. I’m pretty tall but no taller than most men. 
No WiFi so can’t work, which seeing as the train is 45 mins late is a disaster. 
I won’t be booking with grand central again, the LNER service is so much better.

items.title: Dreadful
items.review_text: They used to have one FULL coach (coach B) of unreserved seating so people like ourselves who book last minute could usually find a seat. Not anymore. Every seat was booked. Even to the point that there were FOUR tables at the back taped off for staff to have a break. Wait... What?? Yep, FOUR tables that were used by ONE member of staff to sit and have a cup of coffee while the rest of the paying public had to stand or sit in the vestibule. Surely that's what the spare time at destinations is for, so staff can have a break. This isn't the first time, it's EVERY time. Another annoying thing is the staff don't open the doors until 10 minutes before departure giving you very little time to get aboard and find your seats. All well and good while the staff are sitting enjoying themselves while people wait to board. Absolutely disgraceful service. Apart from one or two of the female staff, the mostly male staff are surly, grumpy and unhelpful. Try LNER or Hull Trains

items.title: Does not even deserve 1 star
items.review_text: Does not even deserve 1 star. So a supposedly dry train from York was full of drunken football supporters. Police who were on the train from King's Cross got off at York. Train security were a joke. When I asked one of them about the driving and the quite frankly scary behaviour I was told I was a " snotty cow and what do you expect me to do?"  This has been reported to the CEO as a formal complaint. Even though the train station  is around the corner from me in Eaglescliffe I will not be using this service again.  Train staff are a joke. The service is a joke. Never again. Please use LNER from Darlington.

items.title: London to York
items.review_text: Crowded first class carriage, noisy children running up and down aisle, not in the slightest bit relaxing, no instructions on how to use QR code, poor quality croissant

items.title: Used to be good
items.review_text:
Used to be good. Totally unreliable these days. I feel sorry for the staff.

This business is owned by a big company but starved of decent rolling stock.

Okay when the train actually turns up. I estimate that’s about 50% of the time.

Feeling lucky?

items.title: Cosy, comfortable, friendly service
items.review_text: I travelled from London to Sunderland for a short-notice visit to family. The trains were clean and comfortable, the staff were approachable, friendly, and helpful, but not intrusive. I noticed the staff doing regular rounds of the train during journeys, and keeping an eye on safety aspects as well as responding to customer needs. There was a significant delay on the return leg of my journey, but the train crew were professional and communicated effectively with passengers, and the driver made up as much time as was safely possible, so we got back in to London with minimal delay. I was very pleased with my experience, and have already recommended booking on to a Grand Central train to family members when they’re planning their next journey!

items.title: Cancelled all trains 11:20pm night before
items.review_text: Cancelled my train and all other direct trains at 11:20pm the day before travel. No reason given. Absolutely appalling service

items.title: Worst trains ever
items.review_text: Got up this morning to find out the train we booked to London is cancelled along with all the rest from my town today. Asif the the train tickets weren't enough they can't even be bothered to show up.

items.title: Had a first class ticket booked but the…
items.review_text: Had a first class ticket booked but the WiFi connection is was so poor I didn't manage to do any work for the two hours. Not a very productive trip

items.title: Staff finding it funny that the driver…
items.review_text: Staff finding it funny that the driver is a no show, round trip in a day to attend business and meeting at 4pm in York, mate ober 30 minutes. Usuam, god i hope they don't get their payrise

items.title: Never again
items.review_text: I booked our train (and seats) from York to Kings Cross in April for travel in July for our family of 4. I got an email the day before travel informing me that the train was cancelled. We were told to get the next available Grand Central train which was two hours later. When we boarded the train it was almost full and every seat had a reserved card on it. We ended up in the middle of the carriage unable to move anywhere as people crammed in from both doors. We ended up with no seats and all 4 of us standing/sitting on the floor for the entire 2 hour journey. The carriage aisle was bunged with people and luggage with at least 15 people standing in the carriage we were in. Most of these people were tourists and had a very poor impression of British rail travel. It is disgraceful that people are treated so despicably. If you are going to cancel trains then put far more carriages on the trains that are running. Why should people who booked seats 3 months in advance have to sit on the dirty floor? I will never travel with Grand Central Railways again.

items.title: I'm a regular on GC trains
items.review_text:
I'm a regular on GC trains, travelling from Brighouse to KGX. Have used them since 2009, at times weekly. I'm a bit surprised by so many negative reviews on here. Firstly the seats: I'm 6'2" so I really like that there is more legroom than on LNER in Standard seats. I agree that the neck curve in the seat back is a bit low, but if you don't try to make your neck fit, it's fine and causes me no discomfort. 

The advance fares are unbeatable and this influences my rating because cost is my most important factor. The staff are great. They seem like regular people: friendly and helpful because they genuinely want to be, not because of some dictat from HR. Ok, it's pot luck if the air con or the wi-fi works in your carriage, but it does so many more times than not. The trains are getting old, they break down more than they should but if a train is cancelled they whisk me off to Wakefield on a coach and pay for me to use my ticket on LNER or whatever it's called these days. I usually get there at the same time I would on GC and sometimes earlier, but the Avanti trains seem bland and characterless in comparison.

Yes, on occasion, I've experienced most of what the one star reviews complain of. But most of the time, it all works as it should. And the trains are full, no matter when I travel, so GC are obviously getting something right. For me, that's giving fantastic value for money.

items.title: Unreliable. Fail to deliver.
items.review_text: Sunday 10th April. 16:27 train Kings Cross to Leeds was cancelled. Next available train my wife was permitted to use her Grandcentral ticket on was the 16:48 with a replacement bus service from Doncaster to Leeds on a bank holiday Monday? No thank you. This despite there being 2 trains before hand which according to Trainline had lots of available tickets but Grandcentral didn’t want to pay LNER to put its passengers on those trains. So paid £72 to put my wife on the next LNER train so she could get back in time for her deadline and have a stress free journey. Couldn’t claim back the Grandcentral fare because it was an advance ticket what ever that means. At the end of the day if they can’t fulfill their obligations the ticket should be refundable regardless of what type it is. We make these trips at least once a month. Rarely an issue with LNER and if there is at least one knows there will be another train along soon. At least LNER reply to their reviews on Trustpilot good ones and bad ones. Not one response on here from Grandcentral. Shame really. I usually like supporting the smaller companies but my advice- it may cost a little more but stick to booking a real railway company - not a pretend one. I certainly won’t be using them again.

items.title: A Lifelong Customer Lost - Abysmal Grand Central Experience
items.review_text:
I write this review with a heavy heart as a once loyal customer of Grand Central. Their service has plummeted drastically, to a point where I can no longer condone using their services. The issues are never-ending and have transformed what was once a dependable train service into a nightmare.

Firstly, the app, a critical tool for any modern traveler, is a labyrinth of problems. Amending or refunding bookings feels like a Herculean task rather than a simple click of a button. The difficulties experienced here alone are enough to deter any potential passenger.

Next, the staff, both onboard and over the phone, have left me aghast. Their attitude is nothing short of despicable, a stark contrast from what one would expect from service providers. The lack of courtesy and professionalism is palpable and has single-handedly tarnished the image of Grand Central for me.

Moreover, the amenities offered to first-class passengers are severely lacking. The comfort and convenience that are supposed to justify the higher ticket price are simply not there, making the first-class experience feel like a hollow promise.

In summary, Grand Central has lost its way. As a lifelong user, it pains me to see the decline and I'm left with no choice but to seek out other train services. Grand Central, you've lost a faithful customer due to your subpar services, appalling staff attitudes, and the lack of amenities for first-class passengers. I implore potential passengers to consider other options before choosing Grand Central.

items.title: A pleasant experience
items.review_text: The train was punctual, clean, there was a buffet car. What more could you want?

items.title: Terrible service hot death trap
items.review_text: In the c coach on the 19:27 out of King’s Cross to Hartlepool no air conditioning and roasting. Disgusting journey.

items.title: Criminal negligence
items.review_text:
I may have been on the same train from London as the other reviewer on 16th June. A warm sunny day and a hellhole of a carriage, no ventilation, no aircon, no blinds on windows to protect from the sun, dirty, grubby carriage with sticky seats, too hot for the buffet to be open and a non-stop journey of 2 hours. But I was lucky, my stop was York, the first one from London, the service was cancelled from York to Sunderland, those with onward travel from York will have got home much later than they planned on a Friday evening and after a shocking journey.
At the time of writing, over 70% of reviewers on TrustPilot have rated the service from this organisation as 1 star, there are clearly a lot of very unhappy people reporting issues that point directly to a lack of essential investment.
The ORR is the regulator, they need to be reading online reviews to help them monitor TOCs, its an easy and cheap source of info on how well TOCs are performing. 
Will it take take someone falling seriously ill, getting hurt or worse before something is done here? It's criminal negligence by Grand Central, Arriva (owners) and the regulator.

items.title: Delayed for 5 hours as train Not running from Halifax station
items.review_text:
When I arrived at Halifax station yesterday to board the 10:40am to London Kings Cross I was informed by the staff that it was not running and had not for the past few weeks !! . I was appalled as I was not informed via email which is the usual procedure with other train companies. To make matters worse my ticket was not going to be accepted by another train company‘i.e LNER. I was advised by the staff at Halifax station  that they were told to inform affected customers to take the next scheduled Grand Central train at 15:03 , effectively a 5 hour delay . I was also informed that it is possible that it may not be  running or buy another ticket for a specified train which they could not guarantee I would get it in time . I couldn’t afford another as I had already spent over £70 for the Return ticket. I also rang customer service and relayed the issue and the agent’s reply was to check the website which did not help as they should have emailed all the affected customers. The first part of the journey on
Friday was by LNER which was a fantastic service. When the Grand Central train  arrived they also promised an at seat service which did not materialise on the return journey . They also arrived 8 minutes later at London Kings Cross as they stopped for over 10 minutes  at Peterborough station in order to AVOID arriving too early, which then impacted my onward journey from Kings Cross ! I’m afraid I will not be using Grand Central again & my friends too .

items.title: Dreadful trip. …
items.review_text: Currently on a train to London King's  Cross.  Had booked first class.  Train arrived. No first class carriage.  Managed to get a seat in standard.  Train jammed with noisy rabble getting high on their alcohol.  This is dire!

items.title: If I could rate 0 stars I would
items.review_text: If I could rate 0 stars I would. Paid £70 to  stand for 2 hours because they overbooked. Greedy company with terrible service, old train and late!! Never again I’ll always travel LNER. AVOID PAY EXTRA IF YOU HAVE TO ITS WORTH IT.

items.title: Buying a ticket with a seat number does not entitle you yo a seat
items.review_text: Paid for a first class ticket on 16:27pm train. They cancelled it. Said I should catch the next train but I’m not guaranteed a seat. That I paid for journey and seats are complimentary. 😂😂😂😂

items.title: Return trip from London to Sunderland
items.review_text: On time. Plug sockets worked. Toilets clean. Very busy and no hot drinks on way back - but nothing really to complain about.

items.title: Abysmal 1st Class Experience
items.review_text:
Thought I'd go 1st class London to Yorkshire. What an absolute joke of a service!

- the carriages clearly hadn't been cleaned during the Kings Cross stop. My assigned seat was covered in rubbish and food remnants. I spent a couple of minutes tidying/cleaning the area but felt really uncomfortable picking the nasty crap off the floor where my bag and feet would go. I ended up waiting to see how busy the carriage got and decided to move.

- when I quizzed the lady member of staff about the mess, she blamed it on people from Sunderland. My mum and dad are from Sunderland! 

- Train WiFi wasn't working at all

- The food ordering system is now done online.goodness knows why they couldn't keep with a more personal service of the staff taking the order. Just doesn't feel right.

- In any case the online ordering system wasn't working for my seats.

- As part of your 1st class offering, you only get option of really basic and small complimentary snack and limited selection of drinks. Everything else you have to pay for. Even a small can of coke is £1.50.

- the toilets were abysmal. No 1st class specific toilet and the one that was in operation was tiny and disgusting.

- and to finish things off, we were 30 minutes late to destination (not necessarily Grand Central's fault, but added to the horrible experience).

All in all, I thought Hull Trains was bad, but this takes the biscuit.

items.title: We do not respond to bad reviews
items.review_text:
It is interesting that in the heading for the TP Grand Central reviews, it says that GC do not respond to negative reviews. Do they even read them one wonders and do they care? Probably not. 

Unfortunately my review related to trains we had booked online using their website being cancelled between York and London in both directions. I accept that trains can get cancelled (annoying though it is) but in this case, why did they not email us to tell us (they have our email addresses in the booking) and looking at the daily cancellations, it is obvious that the two trains we were due to travel on are regularly cancelled. On the GC train we eventually caught, the guard told us "we have significant train reliability problems at the moment, hopefully they will sort them out". This needs to include the toilet which shut itself down because it thought it was full - the guard said it was not full, just having an off day. What made it more challenging for us  is that one of us is wheelchair bound - they managed to automatically cancel our passenger assistance minutes before the train was due to leave but not tell us hours before we were due to leave. It would be nice to know that Grand Central as a company actually care about customer service.

I am however able to say that their staff on the trains go out of the way to be helpful and kind, a pity that their management seem to be useless.

items.title: Just awful, never again.
items.review_text: Too hot, Wi-Fi not working, uncomfortable seats, tiny tables too small to work on, cramped. Just awful. Never again.

items.title: Run down train, too hot.
items.review_text: Run down train that was unbearably stuffy and hot, had to be over 30 degrees. I honestly thought I was going to get heat stroke.

items.title: Train cancelled 4mins before arriving
items.review_text: Train cancelled 4mins before arriving. Worst train line going avoid at all costs!

items.title: A complete joke
items.review_text:
A complete joke.  Train endlessly delayed, coming to a stop every ten minutes for ten minutes.
“First Class” seat came with garbage “snacks” and cold tea.
Never again.

items.title: Do they ever run the 10.37 / 10.40…
items.review_text: Do they ever run the 10.37 / 10.40 service from Halifax to Kings Cross. Yet again the 10.40 (previously 10.37) was cancelled. This is now the 3rd time that I have tried  to catch this train and on each occasion it has been cancelled.

items.title: Avoid this train company as paying for 1st class is NOT worth the hassle or money
items.review_text: I'm on the 11:27am to Sunderland. I booked 1st class as I can't walk to the buffet with a walking stick and then carry a drink back. This is the 2nd journey I've taken this month were the option to be served at my seat was not available, so a very dry journey. I now don't trust GC to have this option available. It seems that saving money takes priority over a good service. I have always chosen GC in the past due to their excellent service and also recommended them to friends - NO longer because they can't consistently live up to their claims of a quality service. The conductor announced this train was fully booked and standing room only. There are people standing in this carriage and the next one, so even if I was able bodied it would be difficult to walk down to the buffet but with a walking stick it's impossible. I feel this is definitely a case of ageism. GC needs to consider that not everyone has a smart phone. On my previous journey I helped to order for an elderly couple who got on at Northallerton and didn't have a phone but the drinks didn't arrive. This train was travelling to London and on asking the ticket inspector, she said they were so busy that catering had switched off the 'at table service'. This couple had travelled up using LNER first class and had expected the same level of service from GC but were really disappointed. On their LNER journey there was a trolley service for 1st class with the option of a hot meal or sandwich, endless tea,coffee,biscuits and no need for a smart phone. They will not be using GC in the future and nor will I.

items.title: Never book with Grand Central because…
items.review_text: Never book with Grand Central because it will cancel your train last minute.

items.title: Awful smell from the coach and toilet demarcation
items.review_text: Was sat on seat c1 and the stench of urine from the toilet was so bad, especially when you lean towards the window, the smell didn't come from the doors, it came through the demarcation between the toilet and the coach which the seat was resting on,it was a horrible 3 hours of my life.

items.title: Great team
items.review_text: I dealt with Suzy at Grand Central today. Very friendly, helpful and informed. Many thanks! Well done Suzy, well done Grand Central.

items.title: Nightmare Journey Both Ways
items.review_text:
On the 13th September I booked First Class to take some flowers to London for our Queen. I was going alone and I’m 78, so thought at least if I book First Class I will be able to have a drink and something to eat going and coming back.
The journey down I received a tea and biscuit. 
I thought Im coming back early just taking my flowers, I will be able to relax and have a drink and something to eat coming back….it was a journey from Hell…everyone getting onto the train was told they could sit in first class, it was heaving and noisy most people shouting they had first class seats free drinks etc.
All I had on this journey home was a cup of tea I went to the Bar for…the two men in charge said we aren’t serving and no food anyway.
I was tired and totally angry.
I emailed a complaint sending copy of tickets …no reply, so I rang she was a very nice lady that said would sought it for me.
The next day I received this email June 
 
I appreciate that our First Class service may differ from other train operators however that is reflected in the price of our tickets. 
 
As previously said, our website does confirm what is available as part First Class as "complimentary refreshments" and these as always are subject to availability.  
 
I apologise however we are not able to provide any compensation.

Kind Regards

Julie Knowles | Customer Relations Consultant | Grand Central 
So please check before booking with Grand Central £130 doesn’t mean you can have a drink or anything to eat…you may not even get the seat you asked for….very disappointed … 
I have now seen an offer of £26 I’m going to accept it but please all … make sure you get the Fabulous First Class Service the offer…June Stead Doncaster

items.title: Excellent customer service
items.review_text:
I had to swap a journey and it was really easy to do with Julie.
She was great and did everything for me.
Excellent customer service.

Very happy

items.title: Just like to say a massive thank you to…

items.title: Do not book first class
items.review_text: Do not book first class. First of all the seats are uncomfortable and curved. We were on the train for over 2 hours and they had run out of most food and drinks. I was left wondering what was the point in buying first class. Avoid if you can.

items.title: So....Lets talk first Class travel with…
items.review_text:
So....Lets talk first Class travel with this company.

Firstly, its a substantial increase on price compared to standard. So lets see what they offer for this First Class Service.

You do get a bottle of water on the table!
No table service for food or drinks though....
You pop along three carriages to collect the food because the app does not work on the train......really...
Okays....collect your food time....Coffee, non available and you can't have a cold drink as they give you water on the table......
So your first class food, only thing left was a granola bar...damn missed out on the croissant....Sandwich? No sir...that's a paid service....
You can get a free bag of crisps!!!!! Aahh....but only Ready Salted, apparently Cheese and Onion are a paid for service....

Okay...lets pay for a sandwich....oops...sorry, do you have Apple Pay? no....then only cash I'm afraid....and I have no change so you need the correct money.....

Seriously? First Class? Wow

items.review_text: Amazing service from Grand central, so happy to assist and resolved an issue I had resulting in me having to get another train and they dealt  with this exceptionally .

items.title: Shakes Ones Head In Disbelief
items.review_text:
Ah, Grand Central Railways, the masters of the rail comedy scene! 🚂🤣

So, picture this: I've been on a quest to find that elusive review option that seems to have gone rogue, and lo and behold, I've finally cracked the case! I will use trust pilot to lock in my opinion to infinity...... and beyond.

Now, my usual steed of choice is LNER, but I've always had this inexplicable fascination with the West Yorkshire - London Kings Cross service by Grand Central, even though I've never had the honour (or horror) of riding it. You see, I hail from the legendary town of Brighouse, a place so devoid of train stations in the '90s that we had to commute via carrier pigeons. So, when I started to see Brighouse, Low Moor, and Halifax listed on the departure board at one of London's grandest train stations, I thought I'd entered an alternate dimension.

But, brace yourselves for the plot twist of the century! I decided to take the plunge on my return trip this week. I call Wakefield home these days, and I could practically roll out of bed and stumble into either Westgate or Kirkgate stations. I mean, I'm about 400 meters closer to Westgate, so that's where my loyalty typically lies. Little did I know what was in store for me by giving Kirkgate and Grand Central a bash..

Now, I'm a connoisseur of first-class travel, and I come equipped with a laundry list of expectations. But here's where the hilarity kicks in: Grand Central Railways redefines first class in the most absurd way possible. You know what a first-class ticket gets you with them? Drumroll, please... a first-class seat! No frills, no thrills, just a fancy chair.

The comedy begins at the station, right smack dab in the heart of the UK. Now, I get it; Grand Central may not be the Godzilla of the rail world, but couldn't they at least cozy up to the lounge provider at Kings Cross? Nope, not a chance! Trying to get some work done in the hour before my train was as futile as teaching a goldfish to juggle.

And then, the grand boarding spectacle! The train itself was, well, let's say "clean-ish." As for the tables, they looked like they'd been ignored since the days of steam locomotives. But let's not dwell on that. What really had me in stitches was the discovery that there was not a single meal in sight on this journey. None, zero, nada! And as if that weren't enough, their boiler decided it needed a vacation, leaving us without hot drinks.

But wait, there's more! Their idea of "table service" is a comedy routine worthy of a standing ovation. You're supposed to scan a QR code to order a drink, and they promise to bring you a snack and a beverage. Sounds promising, right? Well, not on my service! All I got was the message that the venue was closed....But never fear, my fellow traveler's, as a broad Yorkshire accent told us...... you can always embark on an epic quest through standard class to the buffet car, where you can flash your ticket like a VIP for the privilege of buying carrying your own snack back to 1st class.

In summary, Grand Central Railways, you've earned a solid 2 stars from me. And that's only because the seat was comfy enough for a quick nap. Apologies, but this isn't a 5-star journey; it's a 5-star comedy show that had me doubled over with laughter! 🌟🌟😂

items.title: Grand Central overall service…

My wife had a broken foot so had to use a wheel chair and unfortunately we didnt make any up front bookings for assistance ( didnt know we had too ! )However we both have to say a massive thankyou for the Grand Central staff for the excellent service. they honestly couldn't do enough to assist and the lady on the return journey even came back to our coach to ensure we got off safely. items.title: Grand Central - Managing Director Richard McClean...
items.review_text:
Message to Richard McClean M.D.Grand Central Trains

Having booked First Class Open Return £242.95 i would Firstly like to give you some Honest Feedback & having read the Reviews of your Company - Richard McLean it would seem that you either can't be bothered responding to the many many negative reviews - a very Complacent Attitude indeed...

So my Complaint was that after paying £242.95 i really did expect a little MORE than a Complimentary Coffee on my journey to London & having spoken to many of my friends & colleagues it seems that the likes of LNER GNER VIRGIN etc etc provide far More Complimentary refreshments on a morning on the same journey & Richard it would seem they receive More for in many instances a smaller cost...

I didn't expect a Full Breakfast (although look what your competitors provide) it would have been nice to have perhaps a bacon or sausage sandwich on a Complimentary basis as your competitors provide.

I'm very disappointed & will Not be using Grand Central again & as i mentioned at the beginning of this Honest Review IT WOULD SEEM THAT MOST REVIEWS FOR GRAND CENTRAL ARE SHALL WE SAY LESS THAN complimentary,,,,& Richard McClean Managing Director of Grand Central you & your colleagues seem to be INVISIBLE & MUTED to other Customers comments on here....

Poor Poor Poor

Rob

items.title: All services out of London today were…
items.review_text: All Grand Central services out of London today were subject to extremely dangerous overcrowding. There were people crammed on the floor who were elderly and one poor lady had a broken toe having to cling to the moving part of the vestibule.  On my train there must have been at least 90 people standing in each carriage. We stood for 2 hours all the way to Doncaster - never in 30 years of making this journey has that ever happened to me. The conductor came on the tannoy and said the train is full because everyone is using open tickets when that’s not true we all had advanced tickets. To blame the passengers for YOUR mistake as a company is utterly shameful. I sincerely hope there is not a tragic accident in the future with such severe disregard to public safety let alone being covid safe.

items.title: Absolutely disgusting! Never again!

I have spent nearly £250 on tickets for two people from Wakefield to London for this horrific service to be stood in these conditions for a 2 hour journey.

items.title: Don't make an Advance booking with Grand Central during the pandemic.
items.review_text: I have an Advance ticket booking to go from Hartlpool to London in two days (Friday 4th Dec 2020)  As I live in an area which has now moved to tier 3 and London is tier 2 I am unfortunately unable to visit and stay with my daughter.  I have contacted Grand Central customer service who said I have to buy another ticket in order to get a refund on my original ticket - costing double the price.  I have been told that because travel has not been banned I will not receive a refund!!  So I have a choice either to buy a ticket for February costing double the price or travel from a tier 3 to a tier 2 area, stay with my daughter in a one bedroom flat (I can't stay in a Hotel in a tier 2 area).  GRAND CENTRAL HAVE LOST 3 CUSTOMERS who travel at least 4 times each between the North East and London every year and I would advise anyone not to make an Advance Booking reservation with them.

items.title: Refunds
items.review_text:
Bought two advanced singles to York from London to visit family I have not seen in 10 months. Local lockdowns re-applied to my area so I could not travel. GCR would not refund the tickets unless I specifically had contracted COVID. They then stated I can only change the tickets for later dates at a cost and I would have to buy the new tickets first before refunding. 
Please tell me GCR staff, when should I change the travel dates to? When the Pandemic is over? For if you know that I am sure more than one aggrieved customer would be keen to know.... bring back virgin rail. 

Shambolic.

items.title: Rubbish and con
items.review_text: I had tried to use online booking 08.09.2020 but somehow the website not allowed me to do so, so I had to contact their customer services to buy it on phone instead, after purchased a pair of return tickets to York, next day received incorrect tickets, one standard adult, one standard adult with 16-25 railcard, I have to contact the customer services to complain and hope to get the correct tickets, after 72 hours, they had checked it's their fault, as I have not asked for adult ticket with railcard, someone contact me said it will be fully refund within 7 working days on my credit card bill, also, they have cancelled my trip, instead to send me a pair of tickets, I have to go to different website to book my tickets, with no help from Grand Central, yesterday, my credit card bill arrived, what happen! They only paid me back £88.00 instead of £96.00, it should be fully refund!! Bunch of con, stupid people do not understand what customer order, not recommend, I have to pay for their fault!

items.title: Horrendous couldn’t even buy a bottle…
